features: 【Two Pocket Folder Set】RAZCC paper file folders with 2 inner pocket, 3 prongs and 2 business card slots. 50 Pack in off - green, cyan, orange, yellow and magenta, color-code your notes or documents in these specific colors to keep them organized by subject or project.

【Practical Design】Folders with pockets and metal prongs, design with 2 stay-put tabs for fastening 3-hole punched paper, preventing the paper from falling out. Save workspace and keep your important files safe.
【Large Capacity】Made of high quality and strength paper, not easy to break and deform, durable two pocket folders and can hold up 50+ sheets per pocket, ideal for long-term use and storage.
【Perfect Size】Fits standard 8.5" ×11" letter size paper, you can decorate them, adding labels or writing on them to personalize your folders and make them easily identifiable.

【Multifunctional】Paper Folders are great for organizing and keeping your work environment tidy. Ideal for school or office use, for organize and protect classroom assignments or office material, also work well for home projects, receipts, tax paperwork and more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This package of folders seems to be a great bulk buy. I like the vibrant colors and the thick folder. Picked these up for training packets and find myself using them around the house for various projects. Have one that gets dragged around everywhere with me and is holding up better than I could have imagined!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent pocketed folders, in a good variety of colors.
reviews.reviewText: This is a 50 pack of 3 pronged folders. They have pockets on both sides inside. The prongs are great, as you can keep your 3-hole punched papers securely inside, as well as put papers in the pockets. These are not the plastic kind, but the coated cardstock type. The colors are shocking pink, blue, green, yellow, and orange. (In the product pics, it looks like you get red, not pink. I prefer the pink, so yay!) There are 10 of each color.They seem to be holding up so far, so they seem well-made. I was a bit leery because of them being made of cardstock and not plastic, however they seem to be pretty strong. I have had the plastic ones just come apart; these will not do that. I was worried they would rip easily, but they aren't.Very pleased with these!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars good inexpensive folders
reviews.reviewText: exactly as described, they are nice and will last a few semesters. for the price they are a good buy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: these folders are nice and seem to hold up well

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars They do what they say they do
reviews.reviewText: Folders are pretty basic. It's hard to write a review on them unless they're absolutely terrible, or I've had them so long they've proven they're unusually sturdy.They're paper, so I'm guessing they won't hold up over a long period of time, but that's why I got fifty of them. And honestly, they lose stuff like this so often I don't even want plastic ones. My kids go through folders like they're toilet paper. If your kids are in their school years, a fifty-pack of folders is not excessive. If I'd been paying more attention, I probably would have ordered the 100- or 125-pack instead.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I use these folders often to organize papers for work and medical. They work great and are going for a low price. I haven't had any issues with them yet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These two pocket folders are pretty basic but they seem sturdy. I am using them to keep all of my personal records and receipts separate. I have one for home purchases, one for insurances and for taxes. It certainly will make things easier when I am looking for something in particular.
